intro: Tiganophyton, commonly known as the African fireplant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which includes many succulent species adapted to arid environments. The plant produces small, vibrant flowers in shades of yellow and orange, often appearing in clusters during the rainy season. Its leaves are fleshy and succulent, helping it store water in its native habitat. Tiganophyton is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
